description: The private repo desertfoxclan/gamer-build-files has rebuild-src/install-apps.cmd with comprehensive winget installs for Windows. This should be migrated into the dotfiles chezmoi structure. Current content in install-apps.cmd: Core apps (NVIDIA, VC++ redist), Dev tools (VS Code, IntelliJ, Git, Docker, Hugo, etc.), Languages (Go, Node, Java, Python, Anaconda, Rust, .NET 9, Ruby), Cloud SDKs (AWS, Azure, GCP), VS Code extensions (40+), System utilities (CrystalDiskInfo, HWiNFO, etc.), Office (via office-config.xml), General tools (7-Zip, VLC, Chrome, Discord, Bitwarden), Games (Steam, Epic, GOG, etc.), Windows Store apps (Affinity suite), PowerShell modules, Registry tweaks. Migration approach: (1) Add winget package IDs to .chezmoi.toml.tmpl under a windows/personal machine type. (2) Create run_once_install-windows-apps.ps1.tmpl using chezmoi templates. (3) Separate into categories (dev, gaming, productivity) that can be toggled per machine type. (4) Handle VS Code extensions separately (merge with existing extension management). (5) Migrate registry tweaks to run_once_setup-windows-environment.ps1.tmpl.
title: Migrate Windows app installs from gamer-build-files repo

description: The entire secrets pipeline is designed and documented but not turned on. .chezmoi.toml has no [age] section, and dot_secrets.tmpl is a placeholder. Until this is live, API keys have to be manually managed on each machine, defeating the purpose of chezmoi. Steps: generate age key, add [age] to .chezmoi.toml, chezmoi add --encrypt ~/.secrets, update .chezmoiignore for conditional handling, document key storage in Bitwarden.
title: Activate age-encrypted secrets management

description: Add an interactive CLI menu during chezmoi init that asks what 'type' of machine is being provisioned (e.g. personal, work, server/minimal). On a work machine, all config should be applied but application installation should be selective — skip most Brewfile apps and VS Code extensions, but still install 'essential' software. This requires: (1) a chezmoi template prompt or init script that sets a machine_type data field, (2) conditional logic in Brewfile.tmpl to split packages into essential vs full, (3) conditional VS Code extension installation, (4) persisting the choice in .chezmoi.toml so subsequent applies respect it.
title: CLI menu-driven machine type selection for chezmoi init

description: On work machine, Python and Go version checks in Starship regularly exceed the 500ms default timeout, cluttering shell output with warnings. Fix: set command_timeout = 2000 (2 seconds) in the Starship config. This applies across all machine types. The Starship config is likely at home/dot_config/starship.toml or similar chezmoi-managed path.
title: Fix Starship language version check timeouts
